event.title: several times over the last few months

data.event: The achievement gap — the gulf in graduation rates between white students and minority students in Alexandria, which the current ACPS board and senior staff has addressed several times over the last few months — was the central theme of the questions addressed during the Tenants and Workers United’s public forum Wednesday night at Cora Kelly Elementary School.

event.title: addressed during the Tenants and Workers United’s public forum Wednesday night

data.event: The achievement gap — the gulf in graduation rates between white students and minority students in Alexandria, which the current ACPS board and senior staff has addressed several times over the last few months — was the central theme of the questions addressed during the Tenants and Workers United’s public forum Wednesday night at Cora Kelly Elementary School.
The Special Education Advisory Committee is holding the next scheduled public forum — for all candidates — on March 31 at Minnie Howard, with the time yet to be determined.
The Alexandria PTA Council will host three forums, one for each district: the District A forum is planned for April 22 at Mt.
